title: Gold Holds Just Below Record as Traders Wait for Rate-Path Clues
summary: Bullion was trading around $20 an ounce short of a record high set last week, after the Fed reduced rates by 25 basis points on Wednesday.  Prices then retreated from the all-time high after Chair Jerome Powell indicated officials would take a “meeting-by-meeting” approach to future decisions, curbing expectations for rapid easing.  The Fed’s preferred measure of underlying inflation likely grew at a slower pace last month, which would boost the argument for rate cuts.
